snippet: While it is a win for workers, the order signed last week by Mayor Bill de Blasio offers more exemptions and covers fewer sectors than he originally promised.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column observes that while expansion of living wage law in New York City is a win for workers, order signed by Mayor Bill de Blasio offers more exemptions and covers fewer sectors than he originally promised; holds it provides an intriguing glimpse of policy-making in the de Blasio era.
lead_paragraph: While it is a win for workers, the order signed last week by Mayor Bill de Blasio offers more exemptions and covers fewer sectors than he originally promised.

headline.main: In Living Wage Law’s Evolution, a Peek at Policy-Making in the de Blasio Era
headline.print_headline: In Living Wage Law’s Evolution, a Peek at Policymaking in the de Blasio Era
